creator: covener@gmail.com
text:
Multiple occurences of LDAPTrustedGlobalCert essentially make repeated calls to the LDAP SDK -- my guess is that most of them end up with the last setting we push *for the same certype* as opposed to accumulating them.

This appears to the be the case for at least openldap, any thoughts from Novell/Mozilla SDK users would be interesting -- I tentatively plan to add an openldap-specific Note.

creator: rbowen@apache.org
text: Moving docs bugs to docs@httpd.a.o ownership.

If that is true. And I believe to remember that it is, trying it myself with OpenLDAP -- but I don't know if mod_ldap wasn't compiled against an OpenLDAP that was linked against GnuTLS, which has very strange kind of restrictions.

Anyway, does that mean that: http://httpd.apache.org/docs/current/mod/mod_ldap.html#settingcerts this example is wrong too?
As you're saying, you know it's true for OpenLDAP..
creator: i.galic@brainsware.org
